title: Constitutional Convention and Great Compromises

vocab.definition: The agreement that created a two-house legislature
A plan for representation based on state population
A plan for equal representation for all states
The agreement to count enslaved people as 3/5 of a person for representation
A system where power is shared between national and state governments

teachingNotes: Explain the major compromises and why they were necessary. Discuss how the Constitution balanced different interests.

shortanswer.question: How did the Great Compromise satisfy both large and small states?
expectedAny: It created a Senate with equal representation and a House based on population
Small states got equal representation in the Senate while large states got more representatives in the House
The compromise balanced power by giving equal representation in one house and population-based representation in the other

shortanswer.question: Why did large states support the Virginia Plan?
expectedAny: It gave them more representatives based on their larger population
They would have more power with population-based representation
Larger population meant more representatives and more influence

shortanswer.question: Why did small states support the New Jersey Plan?
expectedAny: It gave them equal representation regardless of size
They would have the same power as large states
Equal representation meant small states would not be dominated

shortanswer.question: What is federalism and why was it important?
expectedAny: Federalism shares power between national and state governments
It balanced power so neither national nor state government was too strong
Shared power between national and state levels protected both

shortanswer.question: How does the Senate represent states equally?
expectedAny: Each state has two senators regardless of population
All states get equal representation with two senators each
Every state has the same number of senators

shortanswer.question: How does the House of Representatives reflect population?
expectedAny: Representation is based on state population
States with more people get more representatives
The number of representatives reflects how many people live in the state

shortanswer.question: Why was the Three-Fifths Compromise controversial?
expectedAny: It counted enslaved people for representation but they had no rights
Enslaved people were counted as three-fifths but could not vote
It gave slave states more power without giving enslaved people freedom

shortanswer.question: What problem was the Constitutional Convention trying to solve?
expectedAny: The weak national government under the Articles of Confederation
Problems with the Articles of Confederation made government too weak
They needed a stronger national government to replace the Articles

shortanswer.question: How did compromises help create the Constitution?
expectedAny: Compromises allowed states with different interests to reach agreement
Different states could work together by finding middle ground
Agreements between opposing groups made the Constitution possible

shortanswer.question: Why was representation such a contentious issue?
expectedAny: It determined how much power and influence each state would have
Large and small states disagreed on how to distribute power
Representation affected whether states had equal or proportional influence
